newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suez board agrees with merger principle.
newsitem.headline: Suez board agrees with merger principle.

text.p: Compagnie de Suez said in a statement that its supervisory board, which met on Tuesday to discuss the 1996 results, was unanimously favourable towards the principle of a merger with Lyonnaise des Eaux.
The board will have a special session on April 11 to discuss the details of the deal.

"The chairman (Gerard Mestrallet) has informed the supervisory board of a plan for a merger between Compagnie de Suez and Lyonnaise des Eaux. The board will be called to discuss this plan during a special meeting on April 11," it said.
"Already, the supervisory board has unanimously and favourably received the principle of this merger," it added.
Suez said that it had restructured itself around the two strategic poles of financial services to private individuals and services to local authorities and public infrastructure.
